intro: Simira lancifolia, commonly known as the lancifoliate simira, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
